definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs

sentences.chinese: 他们进行了拼死的斗争。

sentences.english: The people became desperate in their attempt to find a way out.
sentences.chinese: 人们拼死试图找到出路。

sentences.english: Bai Renhu desperate to Jin Shenglie stabbed a knife, I hope he find the heart.
sentences.chinese: 白仁虎拼死向金圣烈刺了一刀，希望他找回人的心。

sentences.english: Fulcrum of violence where the hawk hangs still.
sentences.chinese: 那鹰的静悬之处拼死迈进。

sentences.english: In 1945 the forts were manned by Japanese soldiers determined to hold out to the bitter end.
sentences.chinese: 这些堡垒在1945年又被日本士兵们拼死据守。

sentences.english: The wounded wolf rounded on the hunting dogs and fought to the death.
sentences.chinese: 受伤的狼转身扑向猎犬作拼死搏斗。

sentences.english: She clawed her way to the top of her profession.
sentences.chinese: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她职业的顶峰。

sentences.english: The enemy grew desperate at the defeat.
sentences.chinese: 敌人因战败而拼死挣扎。

sentences.english: I said these people just busted their ass and got me the best job in the world for life.
sentences.chinese: 我说，这些人拼死拼活让我得到世界上最好的工作。

sentences.english: But it pays to plan ahead, just in case the politicians lose the last of their marbles.
sentences.chinese: 但是提前计划有备无患，难说政客们不会拼死一搏。

sentences.english: Weeks already born coward to protect Bai Bao retreat.
sentences.chinese: 周懦生拼死保护白豹撤退。

sentences.english: No flag of truce possible. Men are willing to die, provided their opponent will kill them.
sentences.chinese: 对战败者不饶命，没有谈判的可能，人们拼死厮杀。

sentences.english: It is only a hobby, not a life or death struggle.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一项爱好，不需要拼死拼活地努力。

sentences.english: She clawed her way to the top of her career.
sentences.chinese: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她事业的颠峰。

sentences.english: He slaved to get his own house.
sentences.chinese: 他拼死拼活地干活以便买到属于他自己的住房。

definition: to risk one's life
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to pledge one's life
to risk one's life
to fight with all one's might
to behead/capital punishment/desperate struggle/life-and-death
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
seriously injured
to brave death
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
doom/death/desperately
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to fight with all one has
to charge
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
